lines.gurmukhi: pauVI 1 mUl mMglwcrx
lines.transliteration_english: X

Shabad OS B.translation: Invocation

lines.gurmukhi: nmskwr gurdyv ko siqnwm ijs mMqR suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Namasakaaru Guradayv Ko Sati Naamu Jisu Mantr Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I bow before the Guru (Guru Nanak Dev) who recited the Satnam mantra(for the world).

lines.gurmukhi: Bvjl ivcoN kiF ky mukiq pdwrQ mwih smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhavajal Vichon Kaddhi Kai Moukati Padaarath Maahi Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting (the creatures) across the world ocean He raptly merged them in liberation.

lines.gurmukhi: jnm mrx Bau kitAw sMsw rog ivXog imtwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Janam Maran Bhau Katiaa Sansaa Rogu Viyogu Mitaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He destroyed the fear of transmigration and decimated the malady of doubt and separation.

lines.gurmukhi: sMsw iehu sMswru hY jnm mrx ivic duK sbwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sansaa Ihu Sansaaru Hai Janam Maran Vichi Doukhu Savaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The world is only illusion which carried with it much of birth, death and sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: jm dMf isroN nw auqrY swkq durjn jnmu gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jam Dandu Siraoun N Outarai Saakati Durajan Janamu Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fear of the rod of Yama is not dispelled and the sakts, the followers of the goddess, have lost their lives in vain.

lines.gurmukhi: crn ghy gurdyv dy siq sbd dy mukq krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Gahay Guradayv Day Sati Sabadu Day Moukati Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who have caught hold of the feet of the Guru have been liberated through the true Word.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq gurpurb kir nwm dwn iesnwn diRVHHwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Gurapurabi Kari Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now being full of loving devotion they celebrate the gurprubs (anniversaries of the Gurus) and their acts of rememberance of God, charity and holy ablutions, inspire others also.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw bIau qyhw Plu pwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Beeu Tayhaa Phalu Paaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: As someone sows, so he reaps.

lines.gurmukhi: pauVI 2 jgduqpqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Creation

lines.gurmukhi: piRQmY sws n mws sn AMD DuMD kCu Kbr n pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pridamai Saasi N Maas Sani Andh Dhoundh Kachhu Khabari N Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: First of all, when no breath and body was there nothing was visible in the pitch darkness.

lines.gurmukhi: rkqibMd kI dyih ric pwNc qq kI jVq jVweI
lines.transliteration_english: Rakati Bind Kee Dayhi Rachi Panchi Tat Kee Jarhit Jarhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The body was created through the blood(of mother) and semen (of father) and the five elements were joined judiciously.

lines.gurmukhi: paux pwxI bYsMqro cauQI DrqI sMig imlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paoun Paanee Baisantaro Chauthee Dharatee Sangi Milaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Air, water, fire and earth was put together.

lines.gurmukhi: pMcim ivic Awkws kir krqw Ctmu Aidstu smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Panchami Vichi Aakaasu Kari Karataa Chhatamu Adisatu Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fifth element sky (void) was kept in between and creator God, the sixth one, invisibly permeated among all.

lines.gurmukhi: pMc qq pMcIs guin sqR imqR imil dyih bxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Panch Tat Pancheesi Gouni Satr Mitr Mili Dayhi Banaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To create the human body, five elements and twenty five qualities opposite to each other were joined and mixed.

lines.gurmukhi: KwxI bwxI cilqu kir Awvwgauxu cirqR idKweI
lines.transliteration_english: Khaanee Baanee Chalitu Kari Aavaa Gaounu Charit Dikhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Four life originating mines (egg foetus sweatborn , vegetation) and four speeches(para, pasyanti, madhyama, vaikhari) were assimiliated into each other andthe drama of transmigration was enacted.

lines.gurmukhi: caurwsIh lK join aupweI ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Chauraaseeh Lakh Joni Oupaaee ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus eighty four lacs of species were created.

lines.gurmukhi: pauVI 3 mnu`K jnm dI au`qmqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Grandeur of human birth

lines.gurmukhi: caurwsIh lK join ivic auqmu jnmu su mwxis dyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Chauraaseeh Lakh Joni Vichi Outamu Janamu Su Maanasi Dayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Of the eighty four lacs life classes, birth as a human is the best.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI vyKxu krin suix muiK suB bolxu bcn snyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Vaykhanu Karani Souni Moukhi Soubhi Bolani Bachan Sanayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eyes behold, ears listen to and the mouth speaks sweet words.

lines.gurmukhi: hQI kwr kmwvxI pYrI cil siqsMig imlyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Hathee Kaar Kamaavanee Pairee Chali Satisangi Milayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hands earn livelihood and feet take towards the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: ikriq ivriq kir Drm dI Kit Kvwlxu kwir kryhI
lines.transliteration_english: Kirati Virati Kari Dharam Dee Khati Khavaalanu Kaari Karayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In human life alone by the rightful earning, out of one's savings, other needy ones are fed.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK jnmu skwrQw gurbwxI piV smiJ suxyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Gurabaanee Parhhi Samajhi Sounayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man by becoming gurmukh- Guru oriented, makes his life meaningful; he reads Gurbani and makes others understand (the importance of) bani.

lines.gurmukhi: gurBweI sMqusit kir crxwimqu lY muiK ipvyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurabhaaee Santousati Kari Charanaamrit Lai Moukhi Pivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He satisfies his companions and takes the holy water touched by their feet i.e. he inculcates complete humility.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pvxu n CofIAY klI kwil rhrwis kryhI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pavanu N Chhodeeai Kalee Kaali Raharaasi Karayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Humblytouching of the feet should not be repudiated because in the dark age, this quality is the only asset (of the human personality).

lines.gurmukhi: Awip qry gur isK qryhI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapi Taray Gur Sikh Tarayhee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: People of such a conduct will swim the world-ocean and also get along other disciples of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pauVI 4 jgq kwrx

Shabad OS B.translation: Creation

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwru Awkwr kir eyk kvwau pswau pswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaaru Aakaaru Kari Ayk Kavaau Pasaau Pasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All prevading Oankar through His One Word created the whole expansive cosmos.

lines.gurmukhi: pMj qq prvwxu kir Git Git AMdir qiRBvxu swrw
lines.transliteration_english: Panj Tat Paravaanu Kari Ghati Ghati Andari Tribhavanu Saaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the five elements, as the quintessence He permeated in the three worlds and their denominations.

lines.gurmukhi: kwdru ikny n liKAw kudriq swij kIAw Avqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaadaru Kinay N Lakhiaa Kudarati Saaji Keeaa Avataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That creator could not be seen by anyone who to expand Himself created the infinite nature(prakrti).

lines.gurmukhi: iek dU kudriq lK kir lK ibAMq AsMK Apwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Doo Kudarati Lakh Kari Lakh Biant Asankh Apaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He made myriad forms of nature.

lines.gurmukhi: rom rom ivc riKEn kir bHmMif kroiV sumwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Romi Romi Vichi Rakhiaoni Kari Brahamandi Karorhi Soumaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In His each one hair He gethered up millions of worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: ieks ieks biHmMif ivic ds ds kir Avqwr auqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ikasi Ikasi Brahamandi Vich Dasi Dasi Kari Avataar Outaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And then in one universe He comes in tens of forms.

lines.gurmukhi: kyqy byd ibAws kir keI kqyb muhMmd Xwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaytay Baydi Biaas Kari Kaee Katayb Muhanmad Yaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has created many a dear personality such as Vedavyas and Muhammad dear to the Vedas and the Katebas respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq ieku eyqw pwswrw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Iku Aytaa Paasaaraa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: How wonderfully the one nature has been expanded into many.

lines.gurmukhi: pauVI 5 ju`g Awidk

Shabad OS B.translation: The Yugs

lines.gurmukhi: cwir juig kir Qwpnw siqjug qRyqw duAwpru swjy
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Jougi Kari Daapanaa Satijougu Traytaa Duaapar Saajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The four Ages (yugs) were established and the first three were given names Satyug, Treta, Dvapar. Fourth one was Kaliyug.

lines.gurmukhi: cauQw kiljug QwipAw cwir vrin cwroN ky rwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudaa Kalijougu Daapiaa Chaari Varani Chaaron Kay Raajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: And four castes came to be known as the kings of four ages. Brahmin, kshatriya, vaishya and sudhra became predominate in each age.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmx CqRI vYs sUdR jugu jugu eyko vrn ibrwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamani Chhatree Vaisi Soodri Jougu Jougu Ayko Varan Biraajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Satiyug, Vishnu is said to have come to earth as Hansavaar and explained the problems pertaining to

lines.gurmukhi: siqjuig hMs Aauqwru Dir sohM bHm n dUjw pwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Satijougi Hansu Aoutaaru Dhari Sohan Brahamu N Doojaa Paajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Metaphysics (The story is there in the eleventh canto of the Bhagvat Purana), and nothing but one soham-Brahm was discussed and pondered upon.

lines.gurmukhi: eyko bHmu vKwxIAY moh mwieAw qy bymuhqwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Ayko Brahamu Vakhaaneeai Moh Maaiaa Tay Baymuhataajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting indifferent to maya, people would praise one Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: krin qpisAw bin ivKY vKq gujwrin ipMnI swgy
lines.transliteration_english: Karani Tapasiaa Bani Vikhai Vakhatu Gujaarani Pinnee Saagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They would go to forests and pull on life by eating natural vegetations.

lines.gurmukhi: lK vriHAw dI Awrjw koTy koit n mMidr swjy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakhi Varhiaan Dee Aarajaa Kotday Koti N Mandari Saajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though they lived for lacs of years but they would construct the palaces, forts and grand mansions.

lines.gurmukhi: iek ibnsY iek AsiQru gwjy ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Binasai Ik Asadiru Gaajay ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: On the one hand the world was passing away and on the other the life current would go stably.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 qQwc

Shabad OS B.translation: As Above

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqy CqRI rUp Dir sUrj bMsI vif Avqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Traytay Chhatree Roop Dhari Sooraj Bansee Vadi Avataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Treta in the Sun-dynasty descended in the form of the kshatriya(Ram) a great incarnation.

lines.gurmukhi: nau ihsy geI Awrjw mwieAw mohu AhMkwru pswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Hisay Gaee Aarajaa Maaiaa Mohu Ahankaaru Pasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the nine portions of age lessened and illusion,attachment and ego inflated.

lines.gurmukhi: duAwpuir jwdv vys kir juig juig AauD GtY Awcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Duaapuri Jaadav Vans Kari Jougi Jougi Audh Ghatai Aachaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Dvapar, Yadav-dynasty came to the forefront i.e. the incarnation of Krsna became known to the people; but because of the lack of good conduct, Age by Age, the life span(of man) went on decreasing.

lines.gurmukhi: irg byd mih bHm kiRiq pUrb muiK suB krm ibcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Rig Bayd Mahi Braham Kriti Poorab Moukhi Soubh Karam Bichaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the Rgveda the conduct of the brahmin and the ideas about the actions done facing the East were discussed.

lines.gurmukhi: KqRI Qwpy jujru vyid dyKx muiK bhu dwn dwqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Khatree Daapay Jujaru Vaydi Daykhan Moukhi Bahu Daan Daataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kshatriyas became related to the Yajurveda and started pouring charities while facing the South.

lines.gurmukhi: vYsoN QwipAw isAwm vydu pCm muiK kir sIsu invwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaison Daapiaa Siaam Vaydu Pachhamu Moukhi Kari Seesu Nivaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The vaishyas embraced the Samaveda and bowed to the West.

lines.gurmukhi: irig nIlMbir jujr pIq sÍyqMbir kir isAwm suDwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Rigi Neelabari Jujar Peet Saytanbari Kari Siaam Sudhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blue dress for Rgveda, yellow for Yajurveda and for singing of the hymns of Samaveda wearing of the white dress became a tradition.

lines.gurmukhi: qiHu jugI qRY Drm aucwrw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Trihu Jougee Trai Dharam Ouchaaraa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus three duties of the three Ages were enunciated.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 qQwc

Shabad OS B.translation: As Above

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug cauQw QwipAw sUdR ibriq jg mih vrqweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougu Chaudaa Daapiaa Soodr Birati Jag Mahi Varataaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kalijug became prevalent as the fourth age in which the low instincts gripped the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: krm su irig jujr isAwm ky kry jgqu irid bhu sukcweI
lines.transliteration_english: Karam Su Rigi Jujar Siaam Kay Karay Jagatu Ridi Bahu Soukachaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: People became resultant in performing of the duties enjoined in the Rig, Yajur and Samaveda.

lines.gurmukhi: mwihAw mohI mydnI kil kil vwlI siB BrmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Mohee Maydanee Kali Kalivaalee Sabhi Bharamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The entire earth got enticed by mammon and the antics of the Kalijug put everyone into delusion.

lines.gurmukhi: auTI iglwin jgq ivic haumY AMdir jlY lukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Outthee Gilaani Jagatri Vichi Haoumai Andari Jalai Loukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hatred and degeneracy engrossed the people and ego burnt oneand all.

lines.gurmukhi: koie nw iksY pUjdw aUc nIc siB giq ibsrweI
lines.transliteration_english: Koi N Kisai Poojadaa Ooch Neech Sabhi Gati Bisaraaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nobody now worships anyone and the sense of respect for the younger and elder has vanished into thin air.

lines.gurmukhi: Bey ibAdlI pwqswh kil kwqI aumrwie ksweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaay Biadalee Paatasaah Kali Kaatee Oumaraai Kasaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this cutter age the emporers are tyrants and their satraps butchers.

lines.gurmukhi: rihAw qpwvsu qiHu jugI cauQy juig jo dyie su pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Rahiaa Tapaavasu Trihu Jougee Chauday Jougi Jo Dayi Su Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The justice of three ageshas become extinct and now whosoever gives something (as bribe) gets (justice?).

lines.gurmukhi: krm BiRsit siB BeI lokweI ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Karam Bhrisati Sabhi Bhaee Lokaaee ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mankind has become wanting in dexterity of action.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 Kt SwsqR

Shabad OS B.translation: Six philosiphies

lines.gurmukhi: chu bydwN ky Drm miQ Kit swsqR kiQ iriK suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Chahu Baydaan Kay Dharam Madi Khati Saasatr Kadi Rikhi Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having churned the duties enjoined in the four Vedas, the seers have delineated the six Shastras.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmwidk snkwidkw ijau iqih khw iqvY jgu gwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaadik Sanakaadikaa Jiu Tihi Kahaa Tivai Jagu Gaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: What ever was described by Brahma and Sanak, people recited and followed.

lines.gurmukhi: gwvin pVin ibcwir bhu koit mDy ivrlw giq pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gaavani Parhani Bichaari Bahu Koti Madhay Viralaa Gati Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many think over while reading and singing, but only one among millions understands and reads between the lines.

lines.gurmukhi: ieih Acrj mn AwvdI pViq guxiq kCu Bydu n pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ihi Acharaju Man Aavadee Parhati Gounati Kachhu Bhaydu N Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many think over while reading and singing, but only one among millions understands and reads between the lines.

lines.gurmukhi: jug jug ieko vrn hY kiljuig ikau bhuqy idKlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Joug Joug Ayko Varan Hai Kalijougi Kiu Bahoutay Dikhalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is suprising that every age had dominance of one colour (caste) but how in Kaliyug myriads of castes are there.

lines.gurmukhi: jMdRy vjy qiHu jugI kiQ pViH rhY Brm nih jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jandray Vajay Trihu Jougee Kadi Parhhi Rahai Bharamu Nahi Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: That the duties of all the three Yugas have been abandoned is known to everybody but the confusion persists.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir kiQAw cwir byid Kit swsqiR sMig swK suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Kadiaa Chaari Baydi Khati Saasatri Sangi Saakhi Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the four Vedas have been defined, the description of the six philosophies (Shastras) also complements them.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpo Awpxy mq siB gwvY ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapo Aapanay Mati Sabhi Gaavai ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: They all eulogise their own view point.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 nXwX

Shabad OS B.translation: Nyaya

lines.gurmukhi: goqm qpy ibcwir kY irig vyd kI kQw suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Gotim Tapay Bichaari Kai Rigi Vayd Kee Kadaa Sounaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Speculating seriously, seer Gotama has put forth the story of the Rgveda.

lines.gurmukhi: inAwie swsqR kO miQ kir siB ibiD krqy hiQ jxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Niaai Saasatri Kau Madi Kari Sabhi Bidhi Karatay Hadi Janaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: After churning the thoughts, in the Nyaya school, God  has been defined as the efficient cause of all the causes.

lines.gurmukhi: sB kCu krqy vis hY hor bwq ivic cly n kweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Kachhu Karatay Vasi Hai Hori Baati Vichi Chalay N Kaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Everything is under His control and in His order, no order whatsoever of anybody else is accepted.

lines.gurmukhi: duhI isrI krqwr hY Awip inAwrw kir idKlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Duhee Siree Karataaru Hai Aapi Niaaraa Kari Dikhalaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is in the beginning and at the end of this creation yet in this Shastra he is shown as separate from this creation.

lines.gurmukhi: krqw iknY n dyiKAw kudriq AMdir Brim BulweI
lines.transliteration_english: Karataa Kinai N Daykhiaa Kudarati Andari Bharami Bhulaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: No one has seen or known this creator, and rather people have remained indulged in the expansive delusions of prakriti (nature).

lines.gurmukhi: sohM bHmu CpwiekY pVdw Brmu krqwru suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sohan Brahamu Chhapaai Kai Parhadaa Bharamu Karataaru Sounaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Not realising that soham parbrahm, the jiv is mistaken in understanding Him as a man (full of fallacies).

lines.gurmukhi: irgu khY suix gurmuKhu Awpy Awip n dUjI rweI
lines.transliteration_english: Rigi Kahai Souni Guramoukhahu Aapay Aapi N Doojee Raaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Rgveda exhorts the knowledgeable people that supreme Lord is everything and none else can be compared with Him.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur ibnw n soJI pweI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Binaa N Sojhee Paaee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without true Guru this understanding cannot be attained.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 mImwNsw

Shabad OS B.translation: Mimansa

lines.gurmukhi: iPir jYmin irKu boilAw jujr vyid miQ kQw suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Jaimani Rikhu Boliaa Jujari Vaydi Madi Kadaa Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pondering deeply over the Yajurveda, rishi Jaimini putforth his postulates.

lines.gurmukhi: krmw auqy inbVY dyhI miD kry so pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Karamaa Outay Nibarhai Dayhee Madhi Karay So Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ultimate decision will be arrived at according to the actions performed through the body which will reap whatever it has sowed.

lines.gurmukhi: Qwpis krm sMswr ivic krm vws kir AwvY jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Daapasi Karam Sansaar Vichi Karam Vaas Kari Aavai Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He established the theory of karma and explained transmigration as controlled by karma.

lines.gurmukhi: shsw mnhu nw cukeI krmw AMdir Brim BulwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sahasaa Manahu N Choukaee Karamaan Andari Bharami Bhulaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of its fallacy of ad-infinitum, the doubts are cleared and the jiv goes on wandering in the labyrinth of karmas.

lines.gurmukhi: Brim vrqix jgiq kI ieko mwieAw bHm khwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Karami Varatani Jagati Kee Iko Maaiaa Braham Kahaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Karma is a practical aspect of the world and the maya and the Brahm are identical.

lines.gurmukhi: jujr vyd ko mQin kir qq bHm ivic Brim khwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jujari Vaydi Ko Madani Kari Tat Brahamu Vichi Bharamu Milaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This school of thought (Shastra) while stirring the ingredients of Yajurveda, mixes delusions with the supreme reality the Brahm,

lines.gurmukhi: krm diRVwie jgiq ivic krm bMiD kir AwvY jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Karam Drirhaai Jagat Vichi Karam Bandhi Kari Aavai Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And establishes strongly the ritualism which further accepts coming in and going from the world as the result of the karma bondage.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur ibnw n shsw jwvY ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Binaa N Sahasaa Jaavai ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the true Guru, the doubts cannot be dispelled away.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 vydwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Vedanta

lines.gurmukhi: isAwm vyd kau soiD kir miQ vydwNqu ibAwis suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Siaam Vayd Kau Sodhi Kari Madi Vaydaantu Biaasi Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Vyas (Badarayan) recited Vedanta (sutras) after churning and researching the thought frame of the Samaveda.

lines.gurmukhi: kQnI bdnI bwhrw Awpy Apxw bHmu jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kadanee Badanee Baaharaa Aapay Apanaa Brahamu Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He put up before the self  (atman) as identical to indescribable Brahm.

lines.gurmukhi: ndrI iksY n ilAwveI haumY AMdir Brim BulwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nadaree Kisai N Liaavaee Haoumai Andari Bharami Bhulaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He in invisible and the jiv wanders hither and thither in its delusions of self conceit.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu pujwie jgiq ivic Bwau Bgiq dw mrmu n pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Pujaai Jagat Vichi Bhaau Bhagati Daa Maramu N Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By establishing the self as the Brahm he is in fact established one's own self as worthy of worship and therefore remained unknown to the mysteries of loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: qiRpiq n AwvI vyid miQ AgnI AMdir qpiq qpwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tripati N Aavee Vaydi Madi Aganee Andari Tapati Tapaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Churning of the Vedas could not obtain peace for him and he started scorching one and all in the heat of is ego.

lines.gurmukhi: mwieAw fMf n auqyry jm fMfy bhu duiK rUAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Dand N Outaray Jam Dandai Bahu Doukhi Rooaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The rod of maya always hung over his head and he suffered extremely because of the constant fear of the Yama, the god of death.

lines.gurmukhi: nwrid muin aupdyisAw miQ Bwgvq guin gIq krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Naaradi Mouni Oupadaysiaa Madi Bhaagavat Gouni Geet Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having obtained knowledge from Narad, he recited Bhagvat and thus eulogised God.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu srnI nih koie qrwieAw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Saranee Nahi Koi Taraaiaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without surrender before the Guru none could get across (the world ocean).

lines.gurmukhi: 12 swNK

Shabad OS B.translation: Sankhaya

lines.gurmukhi: duAwpir juig bIqq Bey kljuig ky isir CqR iPrweI
lines.transliteration_english: Duaapari Jougi Beetat Bhaay Kalajougi Kay Siri Chhatr Dhiraaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the passing away of Dvapar, the canopy of kingdom now came over the head of Kaliyuga.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd AQrbix QwipAw auqir muiK gurmuiK gungweI
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Adaravani Daapiaa Outari Moukhi Guramoukhi Goun Gaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Atharvaveda got established and people now would go on eulogising, facing the north direction.

lines.gurmukhi: kpl irKIsuir swNK miQ AQrbix vyd kI ircw suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kapal Rikheesuri Saankhi Madi Adaravani Vayd Kee Richaa Sounaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As a substance of the hymns of Athrvaveda, the Sankhya-sutras were recited by sage Kapil.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn mhw rs pIA kY ismry inq Ainq inAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Mahaa Ras Peea Kai Simaray Nit Anit Niaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Get imbued with the great knowledge and go on pondering over the stable and the transitory.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn ibnw nih pweIAY jy koeI koit jqn kir DweI
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Binaa Nahi Paaeeai Jo Koee Koti Jatani Kari Dhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite millions of efforts, without knowledge nothing can be attained.

lines.gurmukhi: krm jog dyhI kry so Ainq iKn itky n rweI
lines.transliteration_english: Karami Jog Dayhee Karay So Anit Khin Tikay N Raaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Karma and yoga are activities of the body and both these are momentry and perishable.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn mqy suKu aUpjY jnm mrn kw Brmu cukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Giaanu Matay Soukhu Oopajai Janam Maran Kaa Bharamu Choukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Analytical wisdom creates the supreme delight and the illusions of birth and death come to an end.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK igAwnI shij smweI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Giaanee Sahaji Samaaee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru-oriented (gurmukh) get merged in the real self.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 vYSyKk

Shabad OS B.translation: Vaisesik

lines.gurmukhi: byd AQrbn mQn kir gurmuiK bwsyiKk gun gwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bayd Abarabanu Madani Kari Guramoukhi Baasaykhik Goun Gaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By churning of the Athatvaveda, the guru-oriented (Kanad) in his Vaisesik recited about gunas, the qualities (of the matter).

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw bIjY so luxY smy ibnw Pl hiQ n AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Samay Binaa Phalu Hadi N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He produced the theory of sowing and reaping(giving and taking) and told that at appropriate time only, one would attain the fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: hukmY AMdir sBu ko mMnY hukmu so shij smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Houkamai Andari Sabhu Ko Mannai Houkamu So Sahaji Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Everything operates in His divine will, hukam(to which he calls apurva) and whosoever accepts the divine-will stablizes his self in equanimity.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpo kCU n hoveI burw Blw nih mMin vswvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapo Kachhoo N Hovaee Buraa Bhalaa Nahi Manni Vasaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jiva must understand that nothing happens of its own (and our ownselves are responsible for our good or bad actions) and hence nobody as good or bad should be lodged in mind.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsw kir qYsw lhY iriK kxwidk BwiK suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisaa Kari Taisaa Lahai Rikhi Kanaadik Bhaakhi Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rishi Kanad has said that as you sow, so shall you reap.

lines.gurmukhi: siqjuig kw AinAwie suix iek PyVy sBu jgq mrwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Satijougi Kaa Aniaai Souni Ik Dhayrhay Sabhu Jagat Maraavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listen to the injustice of the satyug that only because of a single evil-doer the whole world would suffer.

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqy ngrI pIVIAY duAwpir vMsu kuvMs kuhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Traytay Nagaree Peerheeai Duaapari Vansu Kuvans Kuhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the treta, the whole city  suffered because of one evil-doer and in dvapar this suffering was limited to the one family and the family underwent the igominy.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug jo PyVy so pwvY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijoug Jo Dhayrhay So Paavai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: But in the kaliyug only he suffers who commits evil deed.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 nwg-SySnwg, pwqMjl

Shabad OS B.translation: Sesanag Patanjali-,

lines.gurmukhi: syKnwg pwqMjl miQAw gurmuiK swsqR nwig suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saykhanaag Paatanjal Madiaa Guramoukhi Saasatr Naagi Sounaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh Patanjali the (supposed) incarnation of the Sesnaga, very thoughtfully recited, the Naga-Shastra, Yoga Shastra (Patanjal-Yogasutras).

lines.gurmukhi: vyd AQrbx boilAw jog ibnw nih Brmu cukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Adaravan Boliaa Jog Binaa Nahi Bharamu Choukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He told in consonance with Atharvaveda that illusion cannot be erased without yoga.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir mYlI AwrsI iskl ibnw nih muiK idKweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Mailee Aarasee Sikal Binaa Nahi Moukhi Dikhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is similar to the fact where we know that without cleansing of the mirror, the face cannot be seen in it.

lines.gurmukhi: jogu pdwrQ inrmlw Anhd Duin AMdir ilvlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jogu Padaarad Niramalaa Anahad Dhouni Andari Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Yoga is cleansing praxis through which the surati gets absorbed into the unstruck melody.

lines.gurmukhi: Astdsw isiD nau inDI gurmuiK jogI crn lgweI
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dasaa Sidhi Nau Nidhee Guramoukhi Jogee Charan Lagaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eighteen siddhis and nine treasures fall at the feet of a gurmukh yogi.

lines.gurmukhi: qiHu jugw kI bwsnw kiljug ivic pwqMjil pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Trihu Jougaan Kee Baasanaa Kalijoug Vichi Paatanjali Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In kaliyug, Patanjali talked about fulfillment of desires that remained unfulfilled in the three ages.

lines.gurmukhi: hQo hQI pweIAY Bgiq jog kI pUr kmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Hado Hathee Paaeeai Bhagati Jog Kee Poor Kamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The complete achievement of yogic bhakti is that you every thing hand to hand.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm dwn iesnwnu suBweI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Daanu Isanaanu Soubhaaee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: The jiv should cultivate the nature of rememberance of God, charity and ablution (internal and external).

lines.gurmukhi: 15 jugwN bwbq pRcilq KXwl

Shabad OS B.translation: Ideas in vogue about the Yugs

lines.gurmukhi: juig juig myru srIr kw bwsnw bDw AwvY jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jougi Jougi Mayru Sareer Kaa Baasanaa Badhaa Aavai Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Since time immemorial, on account of the bondage of unfulfilled desires, the jiv has been suffering transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: iPir iPir Pyir vtweIAY igAwnI hoie mrmu kau pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Dhiri Dhayri Vataaeeai Giaanee Hoi Maramu Kau Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Time and again, the body is changed, but the mystery of this change can be understood by becoming knowledgeable.

lines.gurmukhi: siqjug dUjw Brmu kir qRyqy ivic jonI iPr AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Satijougi Doojaa Bharamu Kari Traytay Vichi Jonee Dhiri Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossed in duality in satyug, the jiv entered into the body in treta.

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqy krmw bwNDqy duAwpir iPir Avqwr krwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Traytay Karamaan Baandhatay Duaapari Dhiri Avataar Karaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting caught in karma-bondage in treta

lines.gurmukhi: duAwpir mmqw AhMkwr haumY AMdir grib glwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Duaapari Mamataa Ahan Kari Haoumai Andari Garabi Galaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He was born in dvapar and remained writhing and wriggling.

lines.gurmukhi: qiHu jugw ky krm kir jnm mrn sMsw n cukwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Trihu Jougaan Kay Karam Kari Janam Maran Sansaa N Choukaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the performance of the duties of three ages does not dispel the fear of birth and death.

lines.gurmukhi: iPir kiljug AMdir dyih Dir krmwN AMdir Pyr PswvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Kalijoug Andari Dayhi Dhari Karamaan Andari Dhayri Dhasaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jiv reincarnates in kaliyug and gets entangled in the karmas.

lines.gurmukhi: Aausru cukw hQ n AwvY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Aousaru Choukaa Had N Aavai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Lost opportunity comes not again.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 kiljug qy nwm

Shabad OS B.translation: Activities in Kaliyug

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug kI sux swDnw krm ikrq kI clY nw kweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijoug Kee Soun Saadhanaa Karam Kirati Kee Chalai N Kaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now listen to the discipline of kaliyug wherein nobody cares for the rituals.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnw Bjn Bgvwn ky Bwau Bgiq ibn TOr nw QweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Without loving devotion none will get any place anywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: lhy kmwxw eyq juig ipClI jugIN krI kmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lahay Kamaanaa Ayt Jougi Pichhalee Jougeen Karee Kamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of the disciplined life in the previous ages, the human form has been obtained in kaliyug.

lines.gurmukhi: pwieAw mwns dyih kau AYQO cuikAw TOr n TweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paaiaa Maanas Dayhi Kau Aidau Choukiaa Tdaur N Tdaaee.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug ky aupkwr suix jYsy byd AQrbx gweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Kay Oupakaari Souni Jaisay Bayd Adaravan Gaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As has been said in the Atharvaveda, listen to the redeeming features of kaliyug.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq prvwx hY jg hom qy purb kmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Paravaan Hai Jag Hom Gurapurabi Kamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now feeingful devotion only is acceptable; yajna, burnt offering and worship of the human guru was the discipline of the earlier ages.

lines.gurmukhi: kir ky nIc sdwvxw qw pRBu lyKY AMdir pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Kay Neech Sadaavanaa Taan Prabhu Laykhai Andari Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If somebody now, in spite of being a doer, erases from his self this sense and prefers to be called lowly, only then he can remain in the good books of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig nwvY kI vifAweI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Naavai Kee Vadiaaee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: In Kaliyug, only repeating the name of Lord is considered grand.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 jug grdI

Shabad OS B.translation: Anachy of the ages

lines.gurmukhi: jug grdI jb hovhy aulty jugu ikAw hoie vrqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jougi Garadee Jab Hovahay Ulatay Jougu Kiaa Hoi Varataaraa.

lines.gurmukhi: auTy iglwnI jgiq ivic vrqy pwp BiRsit sMswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Outday Gilaani Jagati Vichi Varatay Paap Bhrisati Sansaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The world gets engrossed in remorseful activities and sin and corruption prevail.

lines.gurmukhi: vrnwvrn nw BwvnI Kih Kih jln bwNs AMigAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Varanaavaran N Bhaavanee Khahi Khahi Jalan Baans Angiaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Different sections(castes) of society develop hatred for one another and finish themselves through squabbles as the bamboos, due to their mutual friction, producing fire burn themselves as well as others.

lines.gurmukhi: inMidAw cly vyd kI smJin nih AigAwin gubwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Nidiaa Chalay Vayd Kee Samajhani Nahi Agiaani Goubaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Condemnation of the knowledge starts and in the darkness of ignorance nothing remains visible.

lines.gurmukhi: byd igrMQ gur hit hY ijsu lig Bvjl pwir auqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Bayd Girand Gur Hati Hai Jisu Lagi Bhavajal Paari Outaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From that knowledge of the Vedas which gets man across the world ocean even the knowledgeable people get away.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur bwJu n buJIAY ijcru Dry n pRBu Avqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Baajhu N Bujheeai Jicharu Dharay N Prabhu Avataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: So long God does not descend on earth in the form of true Guru, no mystery can be understood.

lines.gurmukhi: gur prmysru ieku hY scw swhu jgqu vxjwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Paramaysaru Iku Hai Sachaa Saahu Jagatu Banajaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru and God are one; He is the true master and the whole world craves for Him.

lines.gurmukhi: cVY sUr imit jwie AMDwrw ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Charhai Soor Miti Jaai Andhaaraa ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: He rises like sun and the darkness is dispelled.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 boD mq

Shabad OS B.translation: Intellectualism

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig bODu Aauqwru hY boD AboDu n diRstI AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Bodhu Aoutaaru Hai Bodhu Abodhu N Drisatee Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In kalijug one finds intellectualism incarnate, but discriminating between knowledge and ignorance is nowhere.

lines.gurmukhi: koie n iksY vrjeI soeI kry joeI min BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Koi N Kisai Varajaee Soee Karay Joee Mani Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nobody interdicts anybody and everyone is behaving according in his whims.

lines.transliteration_english: Kisay Pujaaee Silaa Sounni Koee Goree Marhhee Pujaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone instructs for the worship of the inert rocks and someone guides people to worship cemetries.

lines.gurmukhi: qMqR mMqR pwKMf kir klih kRoDu bhu vwid vDwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Tantr Mantr Paakhand Kari Kalahi Krodhu Bahu Vaadi Vadhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to the tantra mantra and such hyprocricies, the tensions anger and quarrels have been increased.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpo DwpI hoie kY inAwrY inAwrY Drm clwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapo Dhaapee Hoi Kai Niaaray Niaaray Dharam Chalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the rat-race for selfish ends, different religions have been promulgated.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI pUjY cMdu sUru koeI Driq Akwsu mnwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Poojay Chandu Sooru Koee Dharati Akaasu Manaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone is woshipping moons, someone sun and someone worshipping earth and sky.

lines.gurmukhi: pauxu pwxI bYsMqro Drmrwj koeI qiRpqwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Paounu Paanee Baisantaro Dharam Raaj Koee Tripataavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Someone is propitiating air, water, fire and yama the god of death.

lines.gurmukhi: Pokit DrmI Brim BulwvY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Dhokati Dharamee Bharami Bhulaavai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: These all are religious hypocrities and are tossing in delusions.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 iB`KU inrxX

Shabad OS B.translation: Of garbs and guises

lines.gurmukhi: BeI iglwin jgq ivic cwir vrn AwsRm aupwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaee Gilaani Jagatri Vichi Chaari Varani Aasram Oupaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In view of the prevaling lassitude in the world, four varnas and four Ashrams were established.

lines.transliteration_english: Dasi Naami Sanniaaseeaa Jogee Baarah Panthi Chalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then ten orders of ascetics and twelve orders Of yogis came into being.

lines.transliteration_english: Jangam Atay Sarayvarhay Dagay Diganbari Vaadi Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Further jangams, the wanderers, sramans and Digambrs, naked jain ascetics also started their disputations.

lines.transliteration_english: Brahamani Bahu Parakaari Kari Saasatri Vayd Puraani Larhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many Categories of brahmins came into being who propounded Shastras, Vedas and Purans contradicting one another.

lines.transliteration_english: Kharhu Darasan Bahu Vairi Kari Naali Chhateesi Pakhand Ralaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mutual irreconcilability of the six Indian philosophies further added many hypocrisies.

lines.transliteration_english: Tant Mant Raasaainaa Karaamaati Kaalakhi Lapataaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Alchemy, tantra,  mantra and miracles became everything for people.

lines.transliteration_english: Ikasi Tay Bahu Roopi Kari Roopi Kuroopee Ghanay Dikhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: By getting divided into myriad sects(and castes) they produced a horrible look.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig AMdir Brim Bulwey ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Andari Bharami Bhulaaay ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: They all were deluded by kaliyug.

Shabad OS B.translation: Islam

Shabad OS B.translation: When varied sects got prevalent, then Muhammad, the beloved of God was born.

lines.transliteration_english: Kaoumi Bahatari Sangi Kari Bahu Bidhi Vairu Virodh Pasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The nation got divided into seventy two divisions and many types of enmity and opposition erupted.

lines.transliteration_english: Rojay Eed Nimaaji Kari Karamee Bandi Keeaa Sansaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The world was bound to roza, id, namaz, etc.

lines.transliteration_english: Peer Paikanbari Auleeay Gaousi Koutab Bahu Bhaykh Savaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pirs, paigambars aulias, gaus and qutabs came into being in many countries.

lines.transliteration_english: Tdaakur Duaaray Ddhaahi Kai Tihi Tdaurhee Maaseeti Ousaaraa.

lines.transliteration_english: Maarani Gaoo Gareeb No Dharatee Oupari Paapu Bidaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Armenians and Rumis were declared apostates (Kafirs) and they were decimated in the Battle fields.

lines.transliteration_english: Paapay Daa Varatiaa Varataaraa ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: The sin became ubiquitious all around.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 ihMdU muslmwn dw twkrw

Shabad OS B.translation: Clash between Hindu and Muslim

lines.transliteration_english: Siro N Mitay Aavani Jaanay ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: Justice of Waheguru,God

lines.transliteration_english: Chaaray Pair Dharam Day Chaari Varani Iku Varanu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dharma was now established on its four feet and all the four castes (through fraternal feeling) were converted into one caste (of  humanity).

lines.gurmukhi: rwxw rMk brwbrI pYrI pvxw jig vrqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raanaa Ranku Baraabaree Pairee Paavanaa Jagi Varataaiaa.

lines.gurmukhi: aultw Kylu iprMm dw pYrw aupir sIsu invwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ulataa Khaylu Piranm Daa Pairaa Oupari Seesu Nivaaiaa.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug bwby qwirAw siqnwmu pViH mMqR suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougu Baabay Taariaa Satinaamu Parhhi Mantr Sounaaiaa.

lines.transliteration_english: Pahilaa Baabay Paayaa Bakhasu Dari Pichhoday Dhiri Ghaali Kamaaee.

lines.gurmukhi: ryqu Aku Awhwru kir roVw kI gur krI ivCweI
lines.transliteration_english: Raytu Aku Aahaaru Kari Rorhaa Kee Gur Keea Vichhaaee.

lines.gurmukhi: BwrI krI qpisAw vfy Bwgu hir isau bix AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaaree Karee Tapasiaa Vaday Bhaagi Hari Siu Bani Aaee.

lines.gurmukhi: bwbw pYDw scKMif nau iniD nwmu grIbI pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaa Paidhaa Sachi Khandi Nau Nidhi Naamu Gareebee Paaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Baabay Bhaykh Banaaiaa Udaasee Kee Reeti Chalaaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Taa Kichhu Ghaali Pavai Dari Laykhai ?25?

lines.transliteration_english: Ditday Hindoo Turaki Sabhi Peer Paikanbari Kaoumi Kataylay.

lines.transliteration_english: Andhee Andhay Khoohay Tdaylay ?26?

lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Naanaku Pragatiaa Mitee Dhoundhu Jagi Chaananu Hoaa.

lines.gurmukhi: bwby ifTI iprQmI nvY KMif ijQY qik AwhI

lines.transliteration_english: Chauraaseeh Sidhi Gorakhaadi Man Andari Ganatee Varataaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Aakhani Sidhi Souni Baaliaa Apanaa Naau Toum Dayhu Bataaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Neechu Kahaai Ooch Ghari Aaee ?28?

lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Pouchhani Sidh Naanakaa Maat Lok Vichi Kiaa Varataaraa.

lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Sidhee Ih Bujhiaa Kali Taarani Naanak Avataaraa.

lines.transliteration_english: Baabay Aakhiaa Naad Jee Sachu Chandramaa Koorhu Andhaaraa.

lines.transliteration_english: Koorhu Amaavasi Varatiaa Hau Bhaalani Charhhiaa Sansaaraa.

lines.transliteration_english: Paapi Giraasee Piradamee Dhaulu Kharhaa Dhari Haytd Poukaaraa.

lines.gurmukhi: isD Cip bYTy prbqI kauxu jgqiR kau pwir auqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sidh Chhapi Baitday Parabatee Kaounu Jagati Kau Paari Outaaraa.

lines.gurmukhi: bwJu gurU fubw jgu swrw ]29]
lines.transliteration_english: Baajhu Guroo Doubaa Jagu Saaraa ?29?

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy pwp kmwvdy aultI vwV Kyq kau KweI
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Paapu Kamaanvaday Ulatee Vaarh Khayt Kau Khaaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Parajaa Andhee Giaan Binu Koorh Kousatu Moukhahu Aalaaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Chaylay Saaj Vajaaiday Nachani Guroo Bahoutu Bidhi Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the gurus are dancing variously to the tunes played by the disciples.

Shabad OS B.translation: The taughts now sit at home and the teachers go their abodes.

Shabad OS B.translation: Qazis enjoy bribes and getting the same they have lost their high regards and position.

lines.transliteration_english: Isatree Purakhay Daami Hitu Bhaavai Aai Kidaaoon Jaaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Varatiaa Paapu Sabhasi Jagi Maanhee ?30?

Shabad OS B.translation: The sin has become ubiquitous in the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: 31 gurU pRIiKAw

Shabad OS B.translation: Testing the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: isDI mny bIcwirAw ikvY drsn ey lyvY bwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Sidhee Manay Beechaariaa Kivai Darasanu Ay Layvai Baalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The siddhs thought in their mind that this body should in all circumstances Adopt philosophy of yoga.

lines.gurmukhi: AYsw jogI klI mih hmry pMQ kry auijAwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Aisaa Jogee Kalee Mahi Hamaray Pandu Karay Ujiaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a yogi in kaliyug, will brighten the name of our sect.

lines.gurmukhi: Kpr idqw nwQ jI pwxI Bir lYvix auiT cwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaparu Ditaa Naad Jee Paanee Bhari Laivani Outdi Chaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One of the Naths, gave him a begging bowl to fetch water.

lines.gurmukhi: bwbw AwieAw pwxIAY ifTy rqn jvwhr lwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaa Aaiaa Paaneeai Ditday Ratan Javaahar Laalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When Baba came to the stream for water, he saw rubies and jewels in it.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur Agm AgwiD purKu kyhVw Jly gurU dI Jwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Agam Agaadhi Purakhu Kayharhaa Jhalay Guroo Dee Jhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This true Guru (Nanak) was unfathomable supreme purusa and who could  bear with his effulgence.

lines.gurmukhi: iPir AwieAw gur nwQ jI pwxI TauV nhI auis qwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Aaiaa Gur Naad Jee Paanee Tdaurh Naahee Ousi Taalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (remaining uninfluenced) returned to the  group and said, O Nath, in that stream there is no water.

lines.gurmukhi: sbid ijqI isiD mMflI kIqosu Apxw pMQu inrwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Jitee Sidhi Mandalee Keetosu Apanaa Pandu Niraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through (the power of the word) Shabad he conquered the siddhs and propounded his altogether new way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug nwnk nwm suKwlw ]31]
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Naanak Naamu Soukhaalaa ?31?

Shabad OS B.translation: In Kaliyug, instead of yogic exercises the name of the Lord who is beyond all sufferings (Nanak) is the only source of delight.

lines.gurmukhi: 32 m`ky dI XwqRw

Shabad OS B.translation: At Mecca

lines.gurmukhi: bwbw iPir mky gieAw nIl bsqR Dwry bnvwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaa Dhiri Makay Gaiaa Neel Basatr Dhaaray Banavaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Donning blue attire then Baba Nanak went to Mecca.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw hiQ ikqwb kiC kUjw bwNg muslw DwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Hadi Kitaab Kachhi Koojaa Baang Mousalaa Dhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: He held staff in his hand, pressed a book under his armpit, caught hold of a metal pot and mattress.

lines.gurmukhi: bYTw jwie msIq ivic ijQY hwjI hij gujwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Baitdaa Jaai Maseet Vichi Jidai Haajee Haji Gujaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now he sat in a mosque where the pilgrms (hajis) had gathered.

lines.gurmukhi: jw bwbw suqw rwiq no vil mhrwby pwie pswrI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaa Baabaa Soutaa Raati No Vali Maharaabay Paai Pasaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: When Baba (Nanak) slept in the night spreading his legs towards the alcove of mosque at Kaba,

lines.gurmukhi: jIvix mwrI liq dI kyhVw suqw kuPr kuPwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevani Maaree Lati Dee Kayharhaa Soutaa Kudhar Kudhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The qazi named Jivan kicked him and asked who was this infidel enacting  blasphemy.

lines.gurmukhi: lqw vil Kudwiedy ikau kir pieAw hoie bijgwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Lataa Vali Khudaai Day Kiu Kari Paiaa Hoi Bajigaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Why this sinner is sleeping his legs spread towards God, Khuda.

lines.gurmukhi: tMgoN pkiV GsIitAw iPirAw mkw klw idKwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Tangon Pakarhi Ghaseetiaa Dhiriaa Makaa Kalaa Dikhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Catching hold of the legs he lynched (Baba Nanak) and lo and behold the miracle, the whole of Mecca seemed to be revolving.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie hYrwnu kryin juhwrI ]32]
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Hairaanu Karayni Juhaaree ?32?

Shabad OS B.translation: All got surprised and they all bowed.

lines.gurmukhi: 33 kwzIAwN mu`lwN nwl pRSnoqr

Shabad OS B.translation: Discussion with the Qazis

lines.gurmukhi: puCin gl eImwn dI kwjI mulwN iekTy hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhani Gal Eemaan Dee Kaajee Mulaan Ikatday Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Qazi and maulvis got together and began discussing religion.

lines.gurmukhi: vfw swNg vrqwieAw liK n skY kudriq koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vadaa Saang Varataaiaa Lakhi N Sakai Kudarati Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A great fantasy has been created and no one could understood its mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: puCin Poil ikqwb no ihMdU vfw ik muslmwnoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhani Dholi Kitaab No Hindoo Vadaa Ki Mousalamaanoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: They asked Baba Nanak to open and search in his book whether Hindu is great or the Muslim.

lines.gurmukhi: bwbw AwKy hwjIAw suiB Amlw bwJhu dono roeI
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaa Aakhay Haajeeaa Soubhi Amalaa Baajhahu Dono Roee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Baba replied to the pilgrim hajis, that, without good deeds both will have to weep and  wail.

lines.gurmukhi: ihMdU muslmwn duie drgh AMdir lhin n FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Hindoo Mousalamaan Dui Daragah Andari Lahani N Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only by being a Hindu or a Muslim one  can not get accepted in the court of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: kcw rMgu ksuMB dw pwxI DoqY iQr n rhoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Kachaa Rangu Kousanbh Daa Paanee Dhotai Diru N Rahoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the colour of safflower is impermanent and is washed away in water, likewise the colours of religiosity are also temporary.

lines.gurmukhi: krin bKIlI Awip ivic rwm rhIm iek Qwie KloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Karani Bakheelee Aapi Vichi Raam Raheem Kudaai Khaloee.

lines.gurmukhi: rwih sYqwnI dunIAwN goeI ]33]
lines.transliteration_english: Raahi Saitaanee Douneeaa Goee ?33?

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole of the world is following the ways of Satan.

lines.gurmukhi: 34 m`ky dI idg ibjX

Shabad OS B.translation: Victory at Mecca

lines.gurmukhi: DrI nIswxI kaus dI mky AMdir pUj krweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dharee Neesaanee Kaousi Dee Makay Andari Pooj Karaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wooden sandal (of Baba Nanak ) was kept as a memory and he was woshipped in Mecca.

lines.gurmukhi: ijQY jwie jgiq ivic bwby bwJu n KwlI jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jidai Jaai Jagati Vichi Baabay Baajhu N Khaalee Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Go anywhere in the world, you would not find a place bereft of the name of Baba Nanak.

lines.gurmukhi: Gir Gir bwbw pUjIAY ihMdU muslmwn guAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Ghari Baabaa Poojeeai Hindoo Mousalamaan Guaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without discrimination of Hindu or Muslim, in every house, the Baba is revered.

lines.gurmukhi: Cpy nwih CpwieAw ciVAw sUrju jgu rusnweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhapay Naahi Chhapaaiaa Charhiaa Sooraju Jagu Rousanaaee.

lines.gurmukhi: buikAw isMG aujwV ivic siB imrgwvil BMnI jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Boukiaa Singh Ujaarh Vichi Sabhi Miragaavali Bhannee Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the lion roared in the jungle the flocks of deer ran away.

lines.gurmukhi: ciVAw cMdu n lukeI kiF kunwlI joiq CpweI
lines.transliteration_english: Charhiaa Chandu N Loukaee Kaddhi Kounaalee Joti Chhapaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If someone wants to conceal moon by putting before it a platter, it cannot be hide.

lines.gurmukhi: augvix qy AwQvxo nauKMf piRQmI sBw JukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ougavanahu Tay Aadavano Nau Khand Pridamee Sabh Jhoukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From rising to setting  directions i.e from east to west, all the nine divisions of earth bowed before Baba Nanak.

lines.gurmukhi: jg AMdir kudriq vrqweI ]34]
lines.transliteration_english: Jagi Andari Kudarati Varataaee ?34?

Shabad OS B.translation: He diffused his power in whole of the world.

lines.gurmukhi: 35 bZdwd gmn

lines.gurmukhi: iPir bwbw gieAw bZdwd no bwhir jwie kIAw AsQwnw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Baabaa Gaiaa Bagadaadi No Baahari Jaai Keeaa Asadaanaa.

lines.transliteration_english: Iku Baabaa Akaal Roupoo Doojaa Rabaabee Maradaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Firstly, Baba himself was in the form of Timeless and secondly, he had his companion Mardana, the rebeck player.

lines.gurmukhi: idqI bwNig invwij kir suMin smwin hoAw jhwnw
lines.transliteration_english: Ditee Baangi Nivaaji Kari Sounni Samaani Hoaa Jahaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For namaz (in his own style), Baba gave call, listening to which the whole world went into absolute silence.

lines.transliteration_english: Sounn Mounni Nagaree Bhaee Daykhi Peer Bhaiaa Hairaanaa.

lines.transliteration_english: Vaykhai Dhiaanu Lagaai Kari Iku Dhakeeru Vadaa Masataanaa.

lines.gurmukhi: puiCAw iPir kY dsqgIr kaux PkIr iks kw Girhwnw
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhiaa Dhiri Kai Dasatageer Kaoun Dhakeeru Kisakaa Ghariaanaa

lines.transliteration_english: Naanak Kali Vichi Aaiaa Rabu Dhakeeru Iko Pahichaanaa.

lines.transliteration_english: Dharati Aakaas Chahoo Disi Jaanaa ?35?

lines.gurmukhi: 36 zwhrI klw

Shabad OS B.translation: Manifest power

lines.gurmukhi: puCy pIr qkrwr kir eyh PkIr vfw AqweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhay Peer Takaraar Kari Ayhu Dhakeeru Vadaa Ataaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The pir debated and came to know that this faquir is much more powerful.

lines.gurmukhi: eyQy ivic bgdwd dy vfI krwmwiq idKlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ayday Vichi Bagadaad Day Vadee Karaamaati Dikhalaaee.

lines.gurmukhi: pwqwlw Awkws lK EVik BwlI Kbru suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paataalaa Aakaas Lakhi Aorhaki Bhaalee Khabari Sounaaee.

lines.gurmukhi: lK Awkws pqwl lK AiK PurMk ivic siB idKlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Aakaas Pataal Lakh Akhi Phurak Vichi Sabhi Dikhalaaee.

lines.transliteration_english: Bhari Kachakaul Prasaadi Daa Dhuro Pataalo Laee Karhaahee.

lines.gurmukhi: jwhr klw n CpY CpweI ]36]
lines.transliteration_english: Jaahar Kalaa N Chhapai Chhapaaee ?36?

Shabad OS B.translation: This manifest power (of the Guru) cannot be made to hide.

lines.gurmukhi: 37 s`iqnwm c`kr

Shabad OS B.translation: Cycle of the true Name

lines.gurmukhi: gV bgdwdu invwiekY mkw mdInw sBy invwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Garh Bagadaadu Nivaai Kai Makaa Madeenaa Sabhay Nivaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: After making Baghdad, the citadels( of pirs)bow, Mecca Medina and all were humbled.

lines.gurmukhi: isD caurwsIh mMflI Kit drsin pwKMif ijxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sidh Chauraaseeh Mandalee Khati Darasani Paakhandi Jinaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He ( Baba Nanak) subjugated the eighty four siddhs and hypocrises of the six schools of Indian Philosophy

lines.gurmukhi: pwqwlw Awkws lK jIqI DrqI jgqu sbwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paataalaa Aakaas Lakh Jeetee Dharatee Jagat Sabaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of underworlds, the skies, earths and the whole world were conquered.

lines.gurmukhi: jIqI nauKMf mydnI siqnwm dw ckR iPrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jeetay Nav Khand Maydanee Sati Naamu Daa Chakr Dhiraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Subjugating all the nine divisions of earth he established the cycle of Satinaam, the true name

lines.gurmukhi: dyvdwno rwkis dYq sB iciqgupiq siB crnI lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dayv Daano Raakasi Dait Sabh Chiti Goupati Sabhi Charanee Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the Gods, demons, raksasas, daity's, Chitragupt bowed at his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdRwsix ApCrw rwg rwgnI mMglu gwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Indraasani Apachharaa Raag Raaganee Mangalu Gaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Indra and his nymphs sang auspicious songs.

lines.transliteration_english: Bhaiaa Anad Jagatu Vichi Kali Taaran Guru Naanaku Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The world filled with joy because Guru Nanak came to give deliverance to the kaliyug.

lines.gurmukhi: ihMdU muslmwix invwieAw ]37]
lines.transliteration_english: Hindoo Mousalamaani Nivaaiaa ?37?

Shabad OS B.translation: He made Hindu Muslim humble and suppliant

lines.gurmukhi: 38 krqwr pur Awgmwn

Shabad OS B.translation: Reaching Kartarpur

lines.gurmukhi: iPir bwbw AwieAw krqwrpuir ByKu audwsI sgl auqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhiri Baabaa Aaiaa Karataarapur Bhaykhu Udaasee Sagal Outaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then Baba (Nanak) returned to Kartarpur where he put aside his attire of a Recluse.

lines.gurmukhi: pihir sMswrI kpVy mMjI bYiT kIAw Avqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Pahiri Sansaaree Kaparhay Manjee Baitdi Keeaa Avataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now putting on a householder’s dress, he sat splendidly on a cot (and executed his mission).

lines.gurmukhi: aultI gMg vhweIEin gur AMgdu isir aupir Dwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ulatee Gang Vahaaeeaoni Gur Angadu Siri Oupari Dhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He made the Ganges flow in opposite  direction because he choose Angad for heading the people (in preference to his sons).

lines.gurmukhi: puqrI kaulu n pwilAw min Koty AwkI nisAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Poutaree Kaulu N Paaliaa Mani Khotay Aakee Nasiaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sons did not obey the commands and their minds turned hostile and unstable.

lines.gurmukhi: bwxI muKhu aucwrIAY huie rusnweI imtY AMiDAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Baanee Moukhahu Ouchaareeai Hui Rousanaaee Mitai Andhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When Baba uttered hymns, the light would spread and darkness dispell.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwnu gosit crcw sdw Anhid sbid auTy Dunkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaanu Gosati Charachaa Sadaa Anahadi Sabadi Outday Dhounakaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Discussions for the sake of knowledge and the melodies of unstruck sound were ever heard there.

lines.transliteration_english: Sodaru Aaratee Gaaveeai Anmrit Vaylay Jaapu Ouchaaraa.

lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Bhaari Adarabaani Taaraa ?38?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh (Nanak) saved the people from the clutches of tantra, mantra and Atharvaveda.

lines.gurmukhi: 39 iSvrwqRI

Shabad OS B.translation: Sivratri fair at Batala

lines.gurmukhi: mylw suix isvrwiq dw bwbw Acl vtwly AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maylaa Souni Sivaraati Daa Baabaa Achal Vataalay Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hearing about the Sivratri fair, Baba (Nanak) came to Achal Batala.

lines.gurmukhi: drsnu vyKix kwrny sglI aulit peI lokweI
lines.transliteration_english: Darasanu Vaykhani Kaaranay Sagalee Ulati Paee Lokaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To have his glimpse the whole humanity swarmed the place.

lines.gurmukhi: lgI brsix lCmI iriD isiD nau iniD svweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lagee Barasani Lachhamee Ridhi Sidhi Nau Nidhi Savaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: More than riddhis and siddhis, the money started pouring in like rain.

lines.gurmukhi: jogI dyiK cilqR no mn ivic irsik GnyrI KweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jogee Daykhi Chalitr No Man Vichi Risaki Ghanayree Khaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing this miracle, the yogis’ anger was aroused.

lines.gurmukhi: BgqIAw pweI Bgiq Awix lotw jogI lieAw CpweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagateeaa Paaee Bhagati Aani Lotaa Jogee Laiaa Chhapaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When some of the devotees paid obeisance (before Guru Nanak), the yogis’ ire deepened and they hid their metal pot.

lines.gurmukhi: BgqIAw geI Bgiq Buil loty AMdir suriq BulweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagateeaa Gaee Bhagati Bhuli Lotay Andari Surati Bhulaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotees having lost their pot forgot their devotion because their attention now was in the pot.

lines.gurmukhi: bwbw jwxI jwx purK kiFAw lotw jhw lukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Baabaa Jaanee Jaan Purakh Kaddhiaa Lotaa Jahaa Loukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The omniscient Baba discovered (and handed over) the pot (to devotees).

lines.gurmukhi: vyiK cilqiR jogI KuixsweI ]39]
lines.transliteration_english: Vaykhi Chalitri Jogee Khounisaaee ?39?

Shabad OS B.translation: Witnessing this the yogis were further enraged

lines.gurmukhi: 40 is`DwN nwl goSt

Shabad OS B.translation: Discussion with the siddhs

lines.gurmukhi: KwDI Kuxis jugIsrwN gosit krin sBy auiT AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Khaadhee Khounasi Jogeesaraan Gosati Karani Sabhay Outdi Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the yogis getting irritated grouped together and came forward to have a debate.

lines.gurmukhi: puCy jogI BMgr nwQu quih duD ivic ikauN kwNjI pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhay Jogee Bhangar Naadu Tuhi Dudh Vichi Kiu Kaanjee Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Yogi Bhangar Nath asked, (Why have you put vinegar in milk?)

lines.gurmukhi: iPitAw cwtw duD dw irVikAw mKxu hiQ n AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhitiaa Chaataa Dudh Daa Rirhakiaa Makhanu Hadi N Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The spoiled milk cannot be churned into butter.

lines.gurmukhi: ByKu auqwir audwis dw viq ikau sMswrI rIiq clweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaykh Outaari Udaasi Daa Vati Kiu Sansaaree Reeti Chalaaee

Shabad OS B.translation: How have you put off yogic garb and attired yourself in a household way.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnk AwKy BMgr nwQ qyrI mwau kucjI AwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Naanak Aakhay Bhangarinaad Tayree Maau Kouchajee Aahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Said Nanak, (O Bhangar Nath, your mother-teacher is unmannerly)

lines.gurmukhi: BwNfw Doie n jwiqEin Bwie kucjy Pulu sVweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaandaa Dhoi N Jaatiaoni Bhaai Kouchajay Phulu Sarhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: She has not cleansed the innerself of your body-pot and your clumpsy thoughts have burnt your flower (of knowledge which was to become fruit).

lines.gurmukhi: hoie AqIqu giHsiq qij iPir aunhu ky Gir mMgix jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Ateetu Grihasati Taji Dhiri Ounahu Kay Ghari Mangani Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: You, while distancing and repudiating house hold life, go again to those householders for begging.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu idqy kCu hiQ n AweI ]40]
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Ditay Kachhu Hadi N Aaee ?40?

Shabad OS B.translation: Except their offerings you don’t get anything.

lines.gurmukhi: 41 is`D krwmwq

Shabad OS B.translation: Miracles by the siddhs

lines.gurmukhi: ieih suix bcn jogIsrwN mwir iklk bhu rUie auTweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ihi Souni Bachani Jogeesaraan Maari Kilak Bahu Rooi Outdaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to this, the yogis snarled loudly and invoked many spirits.

lines.gurmukhi: Kit drsn kau KyidAw kiljuig nwnk bydI AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Khati Darasan Kau Khaydiaa Kalijougi Naanak Baydee Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: They said, (In kaliyug, Bedi Nanak has trampled and driven away the six schools of Indian philosophy).
